title: Interactive US Flight Radar Map with Aircraft Type Filters

requirements.text: Create an interactive flight-radar-style map view that displays aircraft tracks/positions across the continental United States, with pan/zoom and a radar-like visual overlay.

quotes: Build a slight radar track of the tracks aircraft in the United States.

acceptanceCriteria: App loads to a map-focused dashboard view
Map supports pan/zoom over the continental United States
A radar-style overlay (grid/sweep aesthetic) is visible without obscuring markers

requirements.text: Add a map preset that quickly centers/zooms to the Schenectady, New York to Albany, New York corridor, while still allowing users to switch back to a full-US view.

quotes: have a flight radar or so a map from Schenectady, New York to Albany, New York, and throughout the whole continent of the United States.

acceptanceCriteria: A control exists to jump to a Schenectady↔Albany preset view
A control exists to return to a full-US (continental) view
Preset changes update map center/zoom reliably

requirements.text: Implement aircraft data ingestion to display live (or near-live) aircraft positions and track lines, sourced from a configurable REST endpoint. Store the configured endpoint and optional API key in the Motoko backend so it can be updated without redeploying the frontend.

quotes: Build a slight radar track of the tracks aircraft in the United States.

acceptanceCriteria: Frontend requests aircraft position data from a single app-controlled configuration (not hardcoded in UI components)
Backend exposes methods to read/update the aircraft data provider configuration (endpoint URL and optional API key)
When valid data is available, aircraft markers appear on the map and update on a refresh interval

requirements.text: Enable selecting/tapping an aircraft marker to view details including its category: general aviation, military, or commercial.

quotes: You can see and push on what kind of aircraft is is a general aviation, military or commercial

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking/tapping an aircraft marker opens a details panel or popup
The details view shows the aircraft category as one of: General Aviation, Military, Commercial
Selection state is clearly indicated on the map

requirements.text: Add filtering controls to show/hide aircraft by category (general aviation, military, commercial) and reflect the filter state in the map results.

quotes: what kind of aircraft is is a general aviation, military or commercial

acceptanceCriteria: User can toggle categories on/off
Map updates immediately to reflect selected categories
If all categories are disabled, map shows no aircraft markers and an empty-state message

requirements.text: Define and apply a coherent visual theme for the app (colors, typography, layout) that fits a “radar console” aesthetic (avoid blue/purple as primary colors), and enforce it consistently across the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: UI uses a consistent radar-console theme across headers, controls, panels, and map overlay
Primary palette is not blue/purple
Typography and spacing are consistent across main screens

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets required for the radar-console look, and render them from the frontend as static assets (do not serve images through the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated
Frontend references these assets directly (static file paths)
Radar overlay/background image is visibly used in the UI

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths specified by the platform.
nonGoals: Implementing real-time streaming via WebSockets or push updates.
Integrating third-party authentication providers other than Internet Identity.
Guaranteeing global (non-US) coverage beyond the continental United States.

required: Subtle radar screen background with grid, sweep glow, and noise texture in dark green/charcoal (radar-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
